resources.string: ShakeAlertLA sends you notifications when a 4.5 or greater earthquake happens in Los Angeles County, often before you feel shaking. Learn how to get prepared.
Find out more on how to prepare

Build a kit at home, in your car, and at work. Keep at least one week\'s worth of food and medicine on hand for everyone in your family at your home. Rotate food, water, and medications to avoid expired items in your kit. Consider the needs of infants, seniors, and those with medical or disability needs. Here’s a sample of supplies.

Look below to check off supplies for your kit

Under the bed: Sturdy shoes tied to underside of the bed with flashlight in one shoe and extra batteries in the other

Some things to include in your kit:
(each item will have a checkbox to note completion)
Make your home safer to minimize injury and damage during earthquake.
What am I going to get from ShakeAlertLA?

If you need help, your home is damaged, or your location is unsafe, go to a shelter. Open shelters for the City of Los Angeles are listed below. If this information is not clear, call 3–1–1 for shelter locations or other non-emergency information. If you do not live in the City of Los Angeles and need a shelter, contact your city government or listen to news reports for where to seek services.
This app allows us to receive timely earthquake warning alerts in County of Los Angeles.
I agree to the \nTerms and Conditions
An earthquake is happening, you may feel weak shaking at your location.
\nThe ShakeAlert™ earthquake early warning system sends messages that an earthquake has been detected and may affect you.
\nYou may receive the alert before, during, or after shaking. Take protective action as soon as you receive an alert or feel or hear an earthquake. Drop, cover, and hold on.

\nThe early warning function of this app only works in Los Angeles County, California. \nTo get alerts this app does not need to be open. However, you must set the phone’s location services to always on for ShakeAlertLA.

\n\tShakeAlert is NOT a prediction that an earthquake will occur. It signals that an earthquake has started and you may feel shaking. This app is meant to help provide alerts for your safety. Use common sense to stay safe.
Expect severe shaking. Drop, cover, hold on. Protect yourself now!
To get alerts you don’t have to have the app open, but you must set Location Services to "Always On".

Get emergency notifications by signing up for NotifyLA, the City of Los Angeles’ official notification system for messages during emergencies and disasters. Text READY to 888-777 or fill in your information on the site at NotifyLA. \n\nTo help your neighborhood get prepared, learn about our Ready Your LA Neighborhood (RYLAN) program.

For optimal result, the \"Location Services\" should be \"Always On\". ShakeAlert calculates the expected shaking intensity based on the distance between your phone location and the epicenter. An alert will be sent if the pre-set threshold is met. When the last anonymous location is updated, previous location info is overwritten.
For a quick demo on the sample alert and key functionalities

1. Open your device's Settings app.
2. Tap Apps & notifications.
3. Tap the ShakeAlert LA app. If you don't see it, tap See all apps or App info, and then tap the app.
4. Tap App notifications.
Turn on Override Do Not Disturb.
Note: If you don’t see "Override Do Not Disturb", tap Additional settings in the app and then Notifications, then turn on Override Do Not Disturb.
